titleStmt.title: The Dunhuang Manuscripts in the Royal Library of Copenhagen (Petersen 1998)
titleStmt.author: Petersen, Jens O.

encodingDesc.editorialDecl: Input and marked up by Hu and Sam van Schaik in November 2011.

head.p: The Dunhuang manuscripts in the Royal Library of Copenhagen were donated by Arthur Bollerup Sørensen (1880–1932) on 29 November 1915. The Dunhuang collection of the Royal Library of Copenhagen consists of 16 manuscripts in 14 rolls. Except for one Daoist scripture, the manuscripts are Buddhist. The text of MS 2c seems to have been transmitted nowhere else but this collection. MSS 12 and 16 present texts transmitted only in the form of Dunhuang manuscripts in other collections. Both of these are of special interest as they are supplied with colophons.

Roll 2 has been made to supply paper for calligraphy practice. Sheets from various texts have been pasted together and the latter part of the recto has been covered with doodles, including a short text. A large 兑 is found on the verso, indicating that a sheet was discarded because it contained lacunae. Among the doodles one finds three names: Zhai Huixing 翟會興 Wang Dingyuan 王定員 and Dao Gaolong 道高龍. The MSS of this roll are, with the exception of MS 2f, written in the same hand. At least two persons have written the doodles.

Juan 1 of theYogacarābhūmi-śāstra, translated by Facheng 法成. The colophon reads: [Note written on copy of śāstra made] to attend lectures with on the 15th of the 3rd month of the 9th year of Dazhong 大中（A.D.855）by Zhihuishan 智惠山." A copy of the same text made by the same person was in the possession of Wuzhen 悟真（816－895). The text consists of 370 lines (云何瑜珈師 to 處最初入之). The MS translates the same text that Xuanzang translates in T no.1579, vol. 30, pp. 279a.8-283a.20. Facheng's translation has only been transmitted in the form of Dunhuang manuscripts.

Juan 1 of theSi fen jie ben shu四分戒本疏, written by the ṡramana Hui 慧. Marks in red. The text of this juan has been edited and introduced by Tsukinowa Kenryu and Tsuchihashi Shuko. The copist of the present MS was the same as that of the MS (Ryukoku University catalogue no.46) used for their edition. The colophon reads: "Note written by the bhikṣu Faxian after proceeding to the Grottoes of Unsurpassable Height to copy and proofread on the 22nd day of the 10th month of a hai 亥 year." Every twelfth year contains the cyclical characterhai. TheSi fen jie ben shuhas only been transmitted in the form of Dunhuang manuscripts.
